boardgame.name: Porters Pass
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Porters Pass is a part of my micro-location series. These are created to place in small nooks and crannies of your campaigns to give it more spice. The adventurers go traipsing all over the place and sometimes it good to have a little something, something at the ready.Porters Pass does have larger implications, but that can be easily solved with GMing mojo. I present a group, Porters of Gideon, which was in my first published adventure, Knowledge Illuminates. The Porters reason for existing is eliminate items that cause planar travel and to close any gates between planes. With all my micro-adventures I include a batch of adventure seeds to kick start some 'happenings' when the party comes through. Putting them in the middle of something going on is a fun way to engage them and then they'll have to sort it out as they go.I've included a PDF and a map. Please let me know if there is a 'place' you like to see developed. I like to keep the areas smallish then develop its personality and culture. Thanks again to all those who support my Patreon. It is much appreciated.

boardgame.name: The Shallows
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sand zombies! Who's in?

The Shallows was once a haven for criminals, but Lady Androsia cleansed the area less than a year ago. Her decree that this was a forbidden place was posted among a pile of criminals who met with her extreme justice.

Recently, travelers have seen people walking among the ruins. Lady Androsia requests the party to investigate the situation...discreetly. And we all know how tactful and subtle adventuring parties can be.

boardgame.name: Save Charlie
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This adventure comes out of my love to put my players under pressure, putting a clock on them and depending on their speed to action can greatly affect the result. In this adventure an old lady (Meg) wants you to save her pet Charlie. Charlie is a grown ass worg (but a nice one), but he's gone after a grown ass owlbear. Depending on how quick they respond could seal the fate of Mr. Charlie.

boardgame.name: Along Came a Spider
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I bring you Along Came the Spider, my 34th micro-adventure. This one features the map I drew in a map book a good man sent me as a gift. The map that is included was drawn in my vehicle at lunch and scanned in to use for this adventure.

This adventure was inspired by folklore. We've been messing with folklore in our Pits & Perils game and that inspired me to come up with something. A folklore thing. An artifact. But not some powerful magic item, but a thing, a symbol that contains meaning to people who know it. A thing that inspires or causes fear.

boardgame.name: Prison of Gallus
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Here's a grim little situation. You've got a lord who pissed someone off. Someone who cursed his pregnant wife. When their child was born it was a flash eater. A living ghoul. To this disgraceful fact the lord hid away his son, saying it died. But as Gallus grew so did his appetite and his aggressiveness.

Now the lord has imprisoned his son, still hoping to find a solution for the curse. But while he keeps his son alive, he must also feed him and the lord has taken to kidnapping victims.

boardgame.name: Old Warren Castle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a small glimpse at a azer camp. Outsider creatures readying themselves to battle back home. Why were they kicked out? How many of them are there? Who are they fighting? Questions that can be answered or simply ignored.

boardgame.name: The Remains of a Most Unfortunate Party
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I've recently been thinking about and talking a bit about failing. As in the party fails to achieve the goal they set out to complete. As in the party fails because they did not get the cure back to the village soon enough. Or in the ultimate party fail, but one of the more fun, the TPK. This adventure is sort of the aftermath of a failed adventuring party. Various bodies of adventures will be found along the way. Can your players complete what they other party could not. The other party knew what they were going after, yours won't.

boardgame.name: Secrets of the Ancient Well
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Secrets of the Ancient Well

Or as I was originally going to call it, Lloyd Feel Down the Well. This is a straight forward dungeon crawl with new monsters, magic items and a spell. Or more like a spell supplement. I like these kind of adventures because they get the players involved with the locals. I use this relationship to build other adventures and it makes them a little more meaningful when they know who it is they are fighting for.

boardgame.name: Cavern of the Lost Legion
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes I like when the big baddie is just off screen. A looming force that is more of a suggested threat. In The Cavern of the Lost Legion I've done just that. The Lost Legion is represented by a single ghoul still dressed in armor. The party could very well unleash a ghoul horde if they get too curious. Instead this adventure is about escaping before that happens. A little tick-tock in an adventure is always good.

boardgame.name: The Charcoaler's Ransom
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This adventure features one of my favorite villains, Margesh Blackblood. He is always plotting and scheming to take advantage of a situation and turn it into coin. He's done it again. He's captured the local charcoaler, Samuel, and all the charcoal he made. This has crippled the town's economy and forced Lord Garrison to take action. Action meaning, send the adventuring party.

This is one of those adventures where combat should be a last resort. Getting into a fight with Lord Garrison or Blackblood's men could prove costly. This adventure relies on a party to use their wits and come up with a solution to the problem that doesn't result in bloodshed.

But of course, if a bloodbath is what the party wants, give it to them!

boardgame.name: Grim Water Oasis
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Long ago before the first snake crawled from the hole to slither across the virgin sands, there was the trickster. The trickster, an immortal creature with a taste of mischief and misery is the catalyst of this adventure. It sits in the background and watches the events unfold. It presents an obvious situation, an innocent is offered as a sacrificed. Of course the boy must be saved. Of course.
Unknowingly the party may trade the life of one boy for an entire tribe and many creatures. A savory feast for the trickster.

boardgame.name: Cards of Yith
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Card of Yith was originally something else, a ruin city that was taken over by various forms of rats. That lasted only a few paragraphs. Then I rewrote it again, keeping with some of the rats, but led by the weird creepy dude with some weird magical powers that I never worked out. So I put it aside.

A couple months later Jarrod from Mythoard reached out for one of my adventures. So I dusted off the adventure, rewrote it a few more times, was late on my deadline, but Jarod was gracious and accepted my offering of Cards of Yith.

Despite rewriting this adventure six times, I liked how it turned out. I like the idea of magic and emotion mixing and creating a physical thing. In this case, the tragic events mixed with powerful magic manifests itself in cards.

I think it's a cool adventure with some interesting magic items. They are randomly decided by using the table when the players find a card.

boardgame.name: Norker Land
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I love norkers. In a platonic way. One of those well remembered and used creatures from the Fiend Folio from years ago. There isn't much information on these hunched, big fanged creatures. Distant relatives of hobgoblins, lazy, thugish...a description that could describe most humaniods and gamers for that matter.

Norker Land is a simple underground cavern where that norkers live. They live off the fungi that grows there. There is plenty of it and because none of them are getting any more or different than the others it has remain peaceful. Until...

Until part of the cavern roof gave in and introduced two dead cows to the mix. All hell broke loose after that. In norker history will go down as a day of infamy as the War of the Cow. The players happen upon the final days of the war.

boardgame.name: Fort Boyard: Escape Box
boardgame.description:
Can you escape the Fort?

You have just finished the challenges, you have positioned yourself on the code word, but the Boyards do not fall.
Rouge has taken control of the Fort: you have 45 minutes to find a way to bring down the Boyards, take whatever you can and escape.
If you do not succeed, you will remain prisoners.
It's your turn !
You have 45 minutes and not one more!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Réussirez-vous à vous échapper du Fort ?

Vous venez de terminer les épreuves, vous vous êtes positionnés sur le mot-code, mais les Boyards ne tombent pas.
Rouge a pris le contrôle du Fort : vous avez 45 minutes pour trouver le moyen de faire tomber les Boyards, prendre tout ce que vous pouvez et vous enfuir.
Si vous n'y arrivez pas, vous resterez prisonniers.
À vous de jouer !
Vous avez 45 minutes et pas une de plus !

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Band of Bandits
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Serek and his band are holed up in an ruin temple of the dead. Serek managed to find a ring to control the undead guardians. The Ring of Noctum, a magic item that appeared in my very first micro-adventure. Serek will get his own NPC card, with his three followers included. That one will come out later.

boardgame.name: Crypt Hill
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Crypt is a particularly nasty place. I might have a couple of people mention it in passing when the party is low level. I want to start building its reputation as a bad place. When the party finally arrives at Crypt Hill for whatever reason, and for some reason I see myself tying in something about Makidi, allow them to 'feel' the surroundings. As they place a foot on the plateau the ground trembled slightly. And the first time they are attacked by the guardians to have them target a henchmen or other red shirt that's with the party so they can watch what happens to those who dare to violate the crypts.

boardgame.name: Waiting for the Worms
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This adventure starts out simple enough, little Gerry lost his family to the big bad sinkhole, blah, blah. Enough with the crying orphans. Gerry was the sole survivor. I think the little bastard is up to something. He may only be 6-years old, but don't trust him. Gerry is going to be a bad NPC when he gets older.While it is fairly simple encounter the web worms can give an experienced party fits. While the immediate threat is bad, its the long-term threat that could get ugly. All those eggies waiting to hatch to birth baby wormies. While I am sure the party will destroy the eggs, as a GM I like a little cheesey horror mixed with my fantasy. Imagine if you will, the party climbs out of the sinkhole, the eggs blazing in the background, the camera pans slowly to a dark hole. From inside of the hole is the squishy noise of bile covered eggs splitting open. There is a pause, then a batch of baby web worms emerge as the film snaps to black. Just think of the hit the party's reputation might take if they claimed to have cleared the problem only to have it rear up again in a few months. Patrons! Thank you for the support as always. I hope you are enjoying the adventures. Please let me know what you think, good or bad. I can take it. I'm a big boy. Enjoy the adventure!

boardgame.name: The Place Between Places
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So there is this place between places. A dungeon/adventure for the GM to put in the middle of a trek across the countryside. Maybe there is something valuable in there, maybe a lost secret or maybe the GM needs to a quick adventure to buy some time before getting into the next adventure.
This is a straight out dungeon crawl. I've offered a batch of adventure hooks if you need them. But my thought process on this one is a simple crawl, but with potential to have lasting effects for future games.

There is a statuette that is a collector item, stolen personal letters from a young, impressionable noble lady and a weird bear creature terrorizing those villagers who can never seem to take care of themselves. There are plenty of interesting hooks to hang your GM hat on.

boardgame.name: The Weeping Witch
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The people of Scorn are irritable and quick tempered. More than usual. It's two days before the Harvest Moon and all of them are talking or arguing about The Weeping Witch.

boardgame.name: Theodore Banks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I had the map then looked over at the kitchen table, "Hey Ivy, give me a title."

"What kind of title?"

"Any title. What's the first thing that comes to your mind?"

"Theodore Banks."

"Okay."

boardgame.name: Clerk of Vindicta
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Vincent, a particularly hateful and ambitious lowly clerk, is plotting to get a promotion. It doesn't hurt that his boss, a merchant by the name of Horrum, is a thieving, double-crossing, pompous ass. Vincent has sprinkled rumors in the tavern hoping to find an interested group of adventurers to 'assist' him with his promotion. He knows Horrum is planning on selling to a new evil cult. Vincent knows adventurers hate evil cults. It couldn’t have worked out better.

boardgame.name: Dungeon of Scorp Dale
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The adventure is straight forward, but very deadly. Poison that can kill you, undead that can drain you and then there are devils crawling through an open rift. We won't talk about the pit fiend. At least not for a few more levels.

boardgame.name: Totem of the Hag
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So the premise is Guthram Gowt was destroyed when the altarmen stopped making sacrifices to the gods. The gods want their stuff. Because the gods didn't get their stuff they said "Screw you little village Guthram Gowt. You don't give us stuff we take our protection away." Followed by some evil god laugh. Think Vincent Price laughing through Darth Vader's breathing thingy.

boardgame.name: Ruins at Wolf Creek
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ruin at Wolf Creek hints at two of the boss creatures in the area, the death stalker brothers, undead rangers, Maleck and Obadiah. A glimpse at what they do and what's to come. Otherwise this is a found site, a place the party finds while exploring. There are some nasty creatures here that can devastate a party. Image the party's delight and terror as they cross the creek and see a rust monster. That should put some poop in their britches. I haven't used one of those critters in years.

boardgame.name: Mr. Cruddy's Grave
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Some 'villains' are less than threatening. Helpless. Confused. Incompetent. Any of these words describe Cross-Eyed Louie. Despite all this, Louie holds a grudge. His anger for Mr. Cruddy extends past the grave. If you asked Louie why he was so angry at Mr. Cruddy he would look at you like you were the dumbest person in the world, asking the dumbest question in the world. "I hates Mr. Cruddy, cause I hates him. No more explaining than that. Hear?"

This is one of those encounters that starts off comical, but gets real serious when the little mudmen get involved. Those things are no joke.

boardgame.name: Born as Two Die as One
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Here hides the tragic tale of the giant, twin brothers, Jarcaranda and Corazon. Their barrows swallowed by the Komor Forest.

Many years ago the brothers were brought into this world together. They grew larger and stronger than any of their kind had ever seen. They fought side-by-side, winning countless battles, destroying the abominations from the underworld and bringing their mortal enemies to their knees.

Then Jarcaranda became ill. He fought the mysterious aliment for several weeks before finally succumbing. The giant was dead.

Northman custom dictates that since the gods sought to bring twins into this world at the same time, they must also leave this world at the same time. Corazon disagreed.

He battled his own countrymen to remain alive. It wasn't until his father stepped forward armed with an axe he could barely lift that he surrendered. "You bring shame to this family. Your brother will need you in the afterworld. Go."

Corazon entered his barrow with only his armor and axe. He refused to lie in the sarcophagus that was prepared for him. He stood silent at the entrance as they piled the stones to seal him inside.

That was hundreds of years ago. Corazon still stands at the entrance. Waiting.

boardgame.name: Stalker Island
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So I cheated. A little. My next Patreon goal is to get original art for some of the micro-adventures. Well, I couldn't wait. I had one of my favorite artists, Jim Magnusson, come up with the cover. Do you remember the skulks from the original Fiend Folio? Jim created what the players can expect from this adventure, lots of fricking backstabbing.
In addition to the skulks, I used shriekers and shank shrubs. The shrieker is an old school critter that I remember from my first adventures. But I like to add a little something. Something that the party can use. Hackmaster has details on what can be 'harvested' from a creature. For a shrieker, the party can harvest the meat to sell. It's quite good, tastes like shiitake mushrooms.

The shank shrub, not sure where this creature originated, but I saw it on the pages of my Hacklopedia Vol. VII and decided to make use of it. A nasty creature that kills making him, or her, into shrubbery. How can you not like that?

Stalker Island was created for my sandbox using the Swords & Wizardry Light system. I'lll have more information about the sandbox soon.

boardgame.name: Scarlet Hollow: Episode 1
boardgame.description: Scarlet Hollow is an episodic horror visual novel featuring art and writing by comic creator Abby Howard.

boardgame.name: New World Goblin
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I apparently used the word goblin 26 times in a second draft of this adventure. It's not that long. I did a read aloud with Ivy, she said, "you use the word goblin a lot".
"That's cause he's a goblin," I mumbled. Then counted the goblins and started to edit again.

boardgame.name: Temple of Putrescence
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Planting the Seed: This is one of those adventure locations I like to hint at throughout a campaign. Drop hints/rumors about a temple dedicated to a death god somewhere over yonder. Drib of information here, drab of information there and see if the players are interested, but as soon as they are, put a situation in front of them that requires their immediate attention. I think this builds a mystique around the place. Which helps establish a mood/atmosphere before the players even arrive.

Foreshadowing: This is a nasty place. Nearly everything in here can end badly for the players. Even finding the treasure is detrimental. While I don't attempt to balance encounters I do try to give my players clues that they may be in over their head. For example, the party manages to arrive at the temple at 1st or 2nd level, or maybe they are down a person or injured. If the hundreds of bodies laying around isn't enough, have Rogger, the ogre, run out of the temple, screaming like a little girl and jump over the cliff into the water below. If the party wants to go in at that point, let them have at it.

Exploring a Religion: I love developing cults and 'Petty Gods'. Kossuth is a major player though. He stands as one of nine death gods and is very active in this area. While his priests are not well known in this area of the world, there are rumors that this death god has influence in other areas of the world. This temple represents his wrath. Killing and punishing his faithful is not an issue. And as the players explore the area discover Kossuth's appearance in this area over 600 years ago still echoes today.

Artifacts: At the end of the adventure is the Sword of Kossuth. In terms of Swords & Wizardry Light it is a powerful weapon. However, it has some major drawbacks. Drawbacks that can damage a character into retirement or kill him. When I make powerful items I like to develop drawbacks or weaknesses. While this sword won't yell at the player in a Scottish accent, it does have enough awareness that it reacts to certain situations. And like most powerful creatures or items, they are jealous and unforgiving. I encourage the GM who uses the sword to develop specific drawbacks that personal hinder/hurt the character. Much like it tailors its powers to the wielder(such as if a player is fighting a lot of trolls it may start doing fire damage), it also customizes its punishments to hurt the character the most. The Sword of Kossuth is a game changer in a lot of ways, the character that wields it just became the big bad ass, but one misstep and everything could be taken away. That's what I like about artifacts.Well guys, I hope to enjoy this adventure. It's nasty one.

boardgame.name: Sword of Callish
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Greetings Gamers. I offer you my adventure, Sword of Callish. This adventure is item based. A culturally, minor artifact for a culture that no longer exists, but the reason it was exists, to battle undead, is relevant in today's Komor Forest. The adventure exists in a stasis after Isabella, a young acolyte of Kossuth, a death god we met in the Temple of Putrescence, attempted to retrieve the Sword of Callish, but she failed. A character flaw, while an excellent student, she lacked the imagination to think beyond her books.

There are three groups here. The dead adventurers in room 3 who tripped the light fantastic and breathed in the hemlock gas. Second group is dead Isabella in area 5. Before she died she created a totem to Kossuth to create a darkness only she and her minions could see. Her minions were lesser shadows she created from the trapped spirits of the adventurers. The final group is a group of goblins with some bad luck. They discovered this tomb by accident. A heavy rainstorm made them seek shelter and when they entered a great gust of wind slammed the entrance closed jamming it so bad the goblins could not pry it open. Now they are trapped between the darkness and the exit that won't open. They are in a weakened state.

boardgame.name: Ghoul Nest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ghoul Nest. "What?", you ask as you tilt your head to the side. "Why would a ghoul nest?" Good question. "They live in graveyards and eat the almost living." Good point.

boardgame.name: Barbie Groom and Glam Pups
boardgame.description:
Barbie Groom and Glam Pups™ is an all-new, fun and engaging game that lets players choose a pup from one of six adorable breeds, then groom it, train it, and dress it up. Finally, players show off their glam pup in a fabulous dance sequence, runway show and photo shoot! Throughout the game, Barbie™ serves as a mentor, providing instruction and tips to the player.
Key Features:

Choose from 6 different breeds
Bathe, brush, and groom your dog
Try on cute outfits and accessories
Train your pup to do cool tricks
Perform doggie dance routines, fashion shows, and photo shoots
This game comes with a free 1-month V.I.P. trial* that you can use on BarbieGirls.com.  Log in to kick off the fun!

Adopt a pet
Play exclusive games
Create a character
Design a rockin' profile
And more!

(from gamestop.com website)

boardgame.name: Death Coins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Another addition into the ruin/crypt/dungeon areas I am developing to populate the Komor Forest sandbox. What I want to do is make enough of these, then create a random table so folks can randomly populate the forest with these sites. Ideally I would love to get a 100 (stop laughing) of these done of various sizes. There are a few of my older micro-adventures that I could also use, but a 100 is a pie in the sky number.
I've expanded the the Komor Forest monster selection with a new critter, a Grave Guardian. It is basically a dedicated stone golem. Because of its high hit dice value and immunity to normal weapons, it could make a nasty opponent. Also I added blood skeletons. These guys are a nasty lot. More powerful than a regular skeleton and they have a nasty surprise if they are left unattended after their defeat.

You'll find more references to the crow, an important part of the Northmen death mythology. A component of the mythology I added were the death coins. Silver coins with a crow minted on one side, sold by the temples. Northmen believed they could take it with them, but only if they had the right currency. The temples sold the simple death coins at an extortion rates. Today they'd be worth about a 3rd of their weight in silver. In the early days the coins were large and pure silver, in the final age of the Northmen, the temples were corrupted and death coins became small and the silver impure.

boardgame.name: A Terrible Thing Happen to Amos
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Man, the Komor Forest has claimed another life. This place is dangerous. Poor Amos.

boardgame.name: High School Musical 2: Work This Out!
boardgame.description:
School's out, scream and shout! Join Troy, Gabriella, Ryan, Sharpay, Chad and Taylor in the all-new interactive High School Musical experience, High School Musical: Work This Out! Inspired by the record-breaking Disney Channel movie High School Musical 2, this musical adventure game for Nintendo DS allows players to become part of brand new storylines extending beyond the movie sequel all set at the Lava Springs Resort. Play as any of the six High School Musical stars as they work, dance and play their way to winning the Star Dazzle talent show. Explore the lavish Lava Springs country club, carry out daily assignments, find and collect hidden items and rehearse dance routines. High School Musical: Work This Out!, published by Disney Interactive Studios, mixes adventure and rhythm gameplay to bring fans closer to the movies than ever before!

Play as Troy, Gabriella, Ryan, Sharpay, Chad and Taylor and interact with other characters like Kelsi and Zeke
Explore the Lava Springs Resort as seen in “High School Musical 2”
Features all 10 songs from “High School Musical 2”
Listen to the songs even when the Nintendo DS is closed!
Compete to win the Star Dazzle Award
Play with friends wirelessly using one game cartridge

(from Gamestop.com website

boardgame.name: Trickster in the Stone
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Back to the adventure. Trickster in the Stone was inspired by a fellow patron, Si. A while back I asked for places you would like to see drawn and I believe he mentioned wanting a mountain pass. I kinda did that, except underground. One of those underground mountain passes.

boardgame.name: Iron Crawlers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I formatted this adventure to reflect that ascetic back in the day. I use a type font on a single sheet of graph paper background (front and back) and the map, while a bit more embellished than I did back in the day, is simple graph line drawing. Compared to today's clean look, it is rough on the eye so I also included the booklet version with a Garamond font.

boardgame.name: Cave of Undolee
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Komor Forest is filled with strange and dangerous locations. The Cave of Undolee is one of those places. It is located close to Hounds Head, the locals know of it, interact with it, but when the cave 'gets to acting up' they run like hell.

The Cave of Undolee is a powerfully charged location through natural magics.

boardgame.name: Earth Defense Force: World Brothers
boardgame.description: This game takes place in the 3D voxel world, which everything is made up of square pieces. In this world, the Earth is not round but square.

boardgame.name: Kidz Bop Dance Party
boardgame.description:
Dance Your Way to Superstardom with the KIDZ BOP Kids! The #1 music brand for kids 5-12 hits the dance floor. Kids can get movin' with today's biggest dance hits for 1 to 2 players. Step to the beat and learn all the moves from KIDZ BOP Kids, Dana and Valerie.
24 dance hits including KIDZ BOP versions of Paparazzi, Thriller, & Party In The USA.
Create the ultimate dance party in your own living room
All songs sung ‘by kids for kids' with family friendly lyrics
Kids are encouraged to express themselves creatively, there are no ‘losers'
Earn points by learning dance moves from Dana and Valerie and go shopping for kid-cool outfits, costumes, hairstyles, and accessories
Players only need the Wii Remote, no dance pad required
Simple dance steps and controls for younger kids with hints and tips

(from gamestop.com website)

boardgame.name: Maglam Lord
boardgame.description: Maglam Lord takes you on an adventure that involves forging “Magic Swords.” The protagonist is a demon lord who once ran rampant but has since then lost his/her powers. Players will get the option to choose between a male or a female protagonist at the start of the game.

boardgame.name: The Broken Girl
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Broken Girl is an adventure designed so that the party arrives too late to save the girl. Sounds counter intuitive? Here is my GM, world building mind grist. Different adventures have different 'framing'.

boardgame.name: Into the Ruins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The dwarves, greedy and isolationist, considered the other races as enemies. Everyone was plotting to steal their wealth. So they went to war to drive the other races back. The made many enemies, fought on many fronts, and found themselves in a bad spot. They turned to the demons. The dwarves had some dealings with throughout their history and knew demons did not like the other races either. The dwarves target demons with known hostilities toward the elves and humans, allied with them and struck farther into the lands of humans and elves.

Their alliance with demons only fortified the other races to work together. It did not take long for the moral of dwarf and demon to break. They battled amongst themselves. And lost.

boardgame.name: Under Shoal
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Inspiration: This is a map I've had laying around for a while. So I put it to use. Some of the inspiration for this adventure came from the Fiend Folio. I was looking at Fire Snakes, Fire Toads, and Jaculi to populate my place. I enjoy leafing through that tome and rediscovering monsters I've never met in game. What I ended up doing is searching my library of clip art and found an interesting piece by J.M. Woiak and Heather Shinn of the STINKYGOBLIN and creating the Etter Serpent. A nasty little piece of work.

boardgame.name: Cold Forge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the third level the party discovers the dwarves were greedy and paid the price. Think a version of 'Event Horizon' movie. I introduce a new pocket dimension 'The Quiet'. A place where sound doesn't exist. It is rich with minerals, metals, and gems. A honey hole for the dwarves who sought more. It is a difficult area to travel within and the dwarves wanted access to areas no one had even been to. They paid the price.

boardgame.name: A Rite of Gnolls
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Rite of Gnolls is a straight forward encounter. An ambush encounter most likely. You've got a pack of young gnolls looking to earn warrior status within their tribe. They just need a trophy and the adventurers have arrived just on time. As if Yeenoghu ordained the meeting.

However this place existed before the gnolls or the players arrived. Chort, a flesh golem who has seen better days, still tends to the temple and grounds. And then there is a pit. Chort uses it to dispose of debris and bodies if need be. Chort can't have bodies messing up the flow of the temple.

There is also the chaperon. A champion gnoll sent to look after the kiddos in case they get in over their head. He is a possible surprise factor. If he gets close enough he can cause a lot of problems.

This adventure, while straight forward, has a lot of factors to it that can make it go bad for the party. Especially if they piss off Chort.

boardgame.name: Concur Isle / The Last Hook Horror
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's like a old double album. Like Kiss's Alive!, Led Zepplin's Physical Graffiti, and Pink Floyd's The Wall. These adventures are just like that. Well, almost. Minus the friendly radio play songs and playing it in your car while racing down the highway.

User summary:

These twin adventures are each published as a one-page PDF.

boardgame.name: Macceum Sewer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome. The Macceum Sewer is a forgotten place. A place without any history of note. In its hundreds of years of existence it has not garnered the attention from the civilized world, nor the accidental attention of creatures that inhabit the darkness. No artifact to find. No big baddie to kill. No secret to unveil.

Macceum Sewer is a series of tunnels that once had a purpose, but is now a dark home to a random critters with enough treasure to tempt foolish adventurers. The torches need lit. The Macceum Sewer await.

boardgame.name: Uta no Prince-sama Debut
boardgame.description: Visual Novel

boardgame.name: The Many Crypts of Lady Ingrade
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lady Ingrade Malian, a baroness whose holdings consisted of four villages and various homesteads along the southern banks of the Sanchee River, that bordered the halfling territory of Lowhill, was known for her hands on approach. She oversaw the fields and made sure her people had the proper equipment. She cared for her land and the people who tended to it. But Ingrade was known for her quick temper when her motives were questioned or for a perceived slight.

boardgame.name: Three Scenarios for the Compleat Adventurer Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I present to you Three Adventures for the Compleat Adventure. The title is a play off the old Compleat series. I decided to return to my old ways, doing short adventures. Presenting situations to the party to explore, figure out, and possibly defeat. I’ve written three situations for three environments. Design wise the GM has the map on the left page and all the content for the map on the right page. No flipping!

boardgame.name: Requiem of the Giants
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This adventure is short, but holds a key to the an age gone by. It has a nasty undead creature and a deadly trap. Meant to be a destination adventure. Meaning the party is going there to discover answers. For my campaign it would be to discover some of the history of the giants and the secret of discovering how far back the deadly influence of Dedragoria goes.

boardgame.name: Devil's End - Level 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is the first of five levels I have currently mapped. I'm planning for Devil's End to be at least ten levels. Some levels will have different, unconnected sections. Level three is two separate areas. Larger levels, like level 2, is divided into two sections. I want to keep the OPDC layout aspect.

boardgame.name: Prayer Before War
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Prayer Before War is a small shrine built centuries ago. Undiscovered all these years. Probably purposely kept hidden because most people in their right minds know to leave well enough alone. Disturbing the ancient dead never ends well. The lure of gold and silver blinds the thought process. Especially adventurers who are not deterred by danger or the possibility of a life-long curse.

boardgame.name: Forgotten Crypt of Sir Reginald
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sir Reginald was a hero. Died. Praised. Forgotten. And worst of all, became what he hated the most. There are a few other adventures that tell bits of Sir Reginald's story, but they haven't been written yet. They are still clanking around my skull. I'm not sure if they'll ever take form, but either way, this the introduction to the end of his story.

boardgame.name: Jack Jeane
boardgame.description: Visual Novel

boardgame.name: Waters of Oblivion
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Waters of Oblivion is typical of my adventures. A variation on a theme. The party finds a trinket that feels and talks. Something horrible has happened, but it can't quite remember what it was exactly. Then the party explores an underground home of a researcher named Tyber. When those who focus on their goal with fanaticism, they lose sight of not whether they can do it, but rather should they do it. Tyber discovered his answer beneath the waters of Lethe.

boardgame.name: My First Adventure Part 1: Rats in the Cellar
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Yes, I wrote an adventure about rats in a cellar. I know it's a cliched adventure, but I always liked it in video games. I decided to make it into a short three part series. A little twist on it, but I want to keep the adventures simple and straight forward.

boardgame.name: My First Adventure Part 2: Kobold Invasion
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I completed the second leg in the the trilogy of My First Adventure. We left the successful adventurer wondering what the hack is going on. Kobolds? Death Goddesses? It's an old rule, the farther down you go, the more difficult it gets. This adventure is no different. There are a lot more enemies in this level.

boardgame.name: My First Adventure Part 3: The Divine Mother
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Down the stairs you go...

Or do you? With the information gathered by Petra, the goblin merchant, how he came through an opening along the creek outside of town. The adventurer has a choice. Which way? Stairs or creek?

boardgame.name: The Awful State of Pretty Penny
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I've avoided using a vampire in my adventures for years. They've been written about and done to death. But after you shake off all the pop culture dingberries the vampire is still an intriguing and useful antagonist. Vampires go into gaseous form when they reach 0hp, then it drifts off to their next coffin. Perfect for an ongoing enemy. Ulric is in the tradition of a vampire being a evil monster. People are food to him and sometimes helpful (but disposable) servants. Ulric doesn't care if his food is an adult or a child. There is no consideration of mercy or pity.

boardgame.name: Hazelton
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hazelton is the youngest of settlements in the Claven Woods. Emmitt of Scuttle, is responsible for the organization of the workforce. Hazelton has made a lot of progress in its few years. A stockade, two platform towers, and one and a half fields cleared of debris and tress. No easy task.

boardgame.name: Ruins of Kayko
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Abandon over a 100 years ago when the political and religious point-of-views changed. The Callists, a religious group that lived in scattered hamlets, to worship without interference was targeted. Once the Church of Sarrath became the official religion of the region, the Callists were forced out of their homes without notice and marched into the wilderness to ‘find their god’.

boardgame.name: Fort Crow / Erebus Tribe
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Fort Crow has the dubious honor of being the most northern fortification of the Barony of Welles. It is run by a young lord, Sir Cunningham. He was stationed here due to his expendability. A station not awarded due to accomplishment. Despite this, Sir Cunningham has taken it upon himself to make improvements to the rundown fort. He has leverage what influence he has to update the soldiers’ weapons and equipment. This has gained him some favor with the sixty soldiers. Especially Sargent Gallen and Sargent Arelius.

boardgame.name: Fort Sprill / Hedgling
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Fort Sprill was the first structure built to civilize the northern barony. It was constructed to withstand sieges and attacks from giants. Its thick granite walls stand ready to shield those who seek protection. In its day, when it was the northern most fortification, it was an honor to be stationed here. Unlike Fort Crow today.

boardgame.name: Ryou no Oshigoto!
The Ryuo's Work is Never Done!
Ryuuou no Oshigoto!
boardgame.description: A teenage boy named Yaichi Kuzuryu is the strongest shogi player in the world, that is, until one fateful day.

boardgame.name: Gensō Rōgoku no Kaleidoscope
Kaleidoscope of Phantasm Prison
幻想牢獄のカレイドスコープ
boardgame.description: Four friends who attend high school together as second-year students are kidnapped. Steel collars are placed around their necks, with chains attached to a torture chair in each corner of the room. A large cage dangles from the ceiling, in which a silent young boy dressed in all white is trapped. As the girls try to escape, a voice tells them that they are being put through a test with only two possible outcomes: either everyone will die, or one girl will die and the other three will survive.

boardgame.name: Umineko When They Cry Saku: Nekobako to Musou no Koukyoukyoku
うみねこのなく頃に咲 ～猫箱と夢想の交響曲～
boardgame.description: Visual Novel

boardgame.name: Food Girls
boardgame.description: Visual Novel

boardgame.name: Jump King
boardgame.description: Platform

boardgame.name: Megaton Class Musashi
boardgame.description: Robot

boardgame.name: Yo-kai Academy Y: Waiwai Gakuen Seikatsu
Yokai Gakuen Y ~ Wai Wai Gakuen Life ~
boardgame.description: Cartoon

boardgame.name: Ni no Kuni: Cross Worlds
boardgame.description: RPG

boardgame.name: The Choo Choo Game: the train drafting game
boardgame.description:
Choo Choo Game is a Card Drafting game for 2 to 6 players.
Draft a card from the hand to build the longest train. Train carriages must be built in order, Locomotive, Coal carriage, People carriage and Flatbed carriage, The Box Carriage is wild and can be placed anywhere after the Locomotive. If you cannot take a correct carriage from the hand on your turn you must pay a penalty of one carriage from your train. Once a full hand of cannot be drawn the game is over and who ever has the longest train wins.
Features old style art of Locomotives and Carriages.
A Deck of 55 cards.

listing.notes: New copy of The Choo Choo Game.

boardgame.name: 1565, St. Elmo's Pay: Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
1565, St. Elmo's Pay: Promo Pack includes 10 brand new, unique, and gorgeously illustrated cards to add to your games of 1565: St. Elmo's Pay – The Great Siege of Malta

Four new real life events from the Greatest Siege in History, and four more unsung heroes from the battle - including the courageous Salih Reis, and the bold Vincenzo Anastagi - add even more stunningly realised and richly researched content to your Ottoman and Malta decks. Enhance the variety of your gameplay options, and find new ways to surprise your foe - simply shuffle these promo cards into your game and you are ready to go. Also includes two brand new promo cards for the game 1066, Tears to Many Mothers

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Classical Age of the Ottoman Empire
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: 1066, Tears to Many Mothers: The Battle of Hastings Card Game
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: 1066: Tears to Many Mothers – 2 promo cards
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: 1565: St. Elmo's Pay – The Great Siege of Malta

boardgame.name: Keer op Keer Kids
Noch mal!: Kids
boardgame.description:
The kids version of the dice game Encore. There is so much going on in the zoo! Tick the animal enclosures according to the colors of the dice. If you fill many columns quickly, you collect valuable points. Everyone plays at the same time, no one has to wait long, and whoever uses the dice with a little luck and tactical skill wins. And for sure it will be: "Once again!"

—description from the publisher (translated)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 4 Spieldauer: 15 Minuten Altersempfehlung: ab 5 Jahre
Noch mal! Kids Im Zoo ist so einiges los! Kreuzt die Tiergehege entsprechend der gewürfelten Farben an. Wer schnell viele Spalten füllt, sammelt wertvolle Punkte. Alle spielen gleichzeitig, keiner muss lange warten, und wer mit ein bisschen Glück und taktischem Geschick die Würfel nutzt, gewinnt. Und mit Sicherheit heißt es dann: Noch mal!

Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE
Title: Keer Op Keer Kids Publisher: 999 Games Language(s): Dutch

boardgame.name: Operation Jubilee: The Raid on Dieppe August 19, 1942
boardgame.description:
By 1942 the British Admiralty was increasingly fearful of losing control in the skies over the English Channel. Earlier in February the German’s Operation Cerberus saw the battlecruisers Scharnhorst and Gniesenau, as well as the heavy cruiser Prinz Eugen sail up the channel to ports in Germany, beneath the very noses of the RAF and Royal Navy. New German radar and anti-aircraft and shore batteries installed along the north coast of France were making life more dangerous for Allied shipping as well as increasingly dangerous for their bombers crossing the channel to conduct bombing raids in occupied France, Belgium as well as Nazi Germany.

In May it was decided to conduct a raid on the channel port of Dieppe. Vice-Admiral Lord Louis Mountbattan, commander of the British Combined Operations Center, was charged with planning the raid. It was hoped the raid could cause serious damage to the German’s defenses, demonstrate to the Soviets that the Allies were earnest in their desire to quickly take the war to the Germans on the European continent, as well as demonstrating the feasibility of large scale amphibious operations. The RAF was counting on the Luftwaffe also rising up to aggressively defend the skies above Dieppe in a battle the RAF leadership was confident they could win. It was also hoped that intelligence agents, that would land with the 5,000 Canadian and 1,000 British assault troops (along with 50 US Rangers), could perform “pinch” operations to capture German code books, samples of their new radar technology, and perhaps an Enigma code machine (this aspect of the raid was overseen by Ian Fleming, the future author of the James Bond novels). An earlier raid to be launched in July, dubbed Operation Rutter, was cancelled but the raid was resurrected in the first week of August and called Operation Jubilee.

Can you do as well or better than your opponents? Learn and enjoy!

—description from the publisher

listing.notes:
For sale is a brand new copy of Operation Jubilee by the designer and publisher.
Mounted counters for the game are an additional $8.00.
A card set for the game is also available. The card set replaces the standard deck of playing cards called for in the rules, feature graphics by the same artist that did the game's, and has rules reminders on pertinent cards. The Operation Jubilee card set is an additional $10.00.
Paypal gladly accepted. Check or money order only from domestic USA customer.

boardgame.name: Princess Sachi's Siege
boardgame.description:
"The War of the Mortal Thrones drags on and the party has signed on to serve as mercenaries for the forces of the Pheonix Dynasty. Lord Kenshin, the commander of a fortress above a valley devastated by war tells the party of a desperately needed cache of supplies hidden below a castle razed in the first days of the conflict.

The catch is that he has already sent a team in after the supplies, an elite squad under the command of Princess Sachi, the Daimyo's daughter. Not only does the party need to bring the supplies back to their allies, they will need to learn the fate of the princess and, if possible, bring her back as well."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Mythic Americas: Warlords of Erehwon Rulebook
boardgame.description:
The Mythic Americas version of Warlords of Erehwon still keeps at its heart a singular objective in mind – to allow for fast-paced and exciting miniature battles upon a standard-sized table between rival forces known as Warbands. A Warband represents your own band of warriors – courageous humans, blood-thirsty monsters, legendary heroes, and mythological entities from the depths of the darkest myths.

Mythic Americas: Warlords of Erehwon provides a new multi-level, scenario-driven approach to your games. This approach offers plenty of opportunities to reward tactical play, but at the same time keeps things manageable in terms of the size of forces and space required. The game still uses ten-sided and Order dice, making for a game with mechanical depth and considerable adaptability. The Order dice test system, at the mechanical core of Mythic Americas, and an extremely balanced rules set offers Warband leaders great tactical freedom, but the game still offers lots of opportunity for fate and chance to have a say in the outcome of your battles. But, every experienced general throughout the ages knows that fate and chance will test even the most ingenious battle plan!

This is The Way.

The rulebook contains all the rules you need to get playing, a wealth of scenarios and four full army lists for the Tribal Nations, The Aztecs, The Mayans, and The Incas. It also includes background with tactical tips and painting tips for each of the four warbands.

—description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Mythic Americas: Aztec & Tribal Nations Starter Set

boardgame.name: Jurassic Parts: Black Market Promo Card
boardgame.description: When you earn amber for completing dinosaur fossil sets, instead of placing the amber in your pool for spending, place it on this card instead. You cannot use the amber for the rest of the game. At the end during final scoring, every amber placed on this card will score 2 points instead of the usual 1.

listing.notes:
NEW!
+Shipping
PayPal and Venmo payment preferred.
Payment with Paypal or European Bank transfer (IBAN)
Shipping worldwide: 1,50 Please read Seller info below.

boardgame.name: Jurassic Parts: One Dino Podcast
boardgame.description:
Remove up to 3 concealed tiles from the Slab and secretly look at them. You may mix them up; then return them face down in any orientation. If there are chisels on the tiles, they remain in the same placement when the tiles are returned.


This promo card was made for the "One Board Family" media team who do reviews, podcasts, etc.

boardgame.name: Escape Box: Mystère au Louvre
boardgame.description:
Mystery in the largest museum in the world!

Your class won a competition and you won a private tour of the Louvre for 45 minutes.
However, the curator of the Egyptian archeology department who was to accompany you disappeared along with a mysterious sarcophagus ...

It's up to you to search the 7 departments of the museum to try to find them!

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Puzzle & Dragons Trading Card Game
boardgame.description:
Puzzle & Dragons Trading Card Game is the trading card game version of famous mobile game Puzzle & Dragons.
In this game, players need turn beads to gain combos like play the mobile game.
Like most tcgs, players also need use monsters to fight with you opponent and the player makes his opponent's life to zero will win the game.

boardgame.name: Elemies
boardgame.description:
The Elemies Card Game is the first manifestation of the Elemies World. It’s a game of character, strategy, adaptability, and teamwork. It is played by four players split into two teams. Get rid of your cards first, win the battles, and collect treasure points for your team. Be ready to lead and to follow; attack and hold your ground. The world of Elemies demands balance.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: ABspecken
boardgame.description:
A roll-and-discard game for 2-5 players from age 8.
Players place 24 cards with numbers 1 to 6 - 4 of each number - in 6 stacks in front of themselves. Their aim is to get rid of all cards as soon as possible. To do so, each player takes 5 cards in her/his hand, then the three dice are thrown. The pips and colour shown by the dice now offer possibilities for the players to discard some of their cards („abspecken“), or they imply restrictions, depending on the combination of the 5 cards a player holds in her/his hand. So the players need to do some deduction to keep their chances for winning the game.
As soon as one player got rid of all of his 24 cards the game round is over. The players who still have cards collect minus points. The game ends as soon as one of the players has collected 33 minus points in total.
ABspecken is an easy-to-start family game which implies some challenges in combination and a certain proportion of good or bad luck.

—user summary

Note by the publisher: Interested in licencing ABspecken? Contact us on info@biwo-spiele.de

boardgame.name: Spell Card Strike
スペルカードストライク
boardgame.description:
Spell Card Strike (スペルカードストライク) is a doujin card game of Touhou Project designed by doujin group AQUA STYLE.

Spell Card Strike is a one-on-one battle-type card game that uses the power of the "Spell Card" that appears in the Touhou Project.

Call the girl who owns the spell card as a "striker" on the 5x4 "stage", unfold the barrage pretend. The battle on the board with up to 12 strikers, including both enemies and allies, gives you a feeling of play like a strategy simulation game.

boardgame.name: Destiny or Fate
boardgame.description:
Destiny or Fate (DoF) is a deck-building roguelike game. You may obtain more than 180 different cards which help you to attack monsters, defend your allies and strengthen your party. Recruit defeated monsters with skills that have caused you trouble so you can get revenge in the next battle. With your unique deck of cards, your hero and the newly recruited monsters, you can work out your individual strategy and set out on an epic adventure.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Lich Wars
boardgame.description:
Inspired by classic TCGs like Magic The Gathering, Lich Wars is a fast-paced strategic card game for 2-4 players where you play as rival liches vying for supremacy! Command hordes of undead minions and cast devastating spells as you attempt to destroy your opponents' phylactery life sources and be the last player standing!

The goal of the game is to eliminate every other player by destroying their life source: one of their three phylacteries. Each player begins the game with three phylactery cards, but only one is keeping them in the game. In order to be victorious, you will need to uncover and destroy your opponents' phylacteries while also keeping yours well protected!

Gameplay elements include:

- Resource management
- Deduction / Bluffing
- Action point system
- Powerful combos and synergies
- Lots of "Take that!" moments
- A bit of luck!

At the start of the game, players first need to start placing down resource collecting minions. These are placed behind a phylactery and will be used for the duration of the game to fuel both your attacks and defense by producing blood, bones, and souls equal to their cost. These resources will be used to play other minions.
Ensure that your phylacteries are safe by guarding them with your minions. Using resources from your collector minions, you can place down a defender to protect one of your phylacteries. Build a strong defense by placing high health minions as defenders, and having spells ready to counter attacks.
There are countless ways to overcome your opponents' defenses and seal your victory! Once you have enough resources from your collector minions, launch your attack by spending symbols equal to your attacker's cost. Buff your minion with spells to create an unstoppable assault!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: ARS BELLUM: Extension Perses
boardgame.description:
Expand your prospects for glory with ARS BELLUM game expansions.
In this expansion, find the Persian army and its multitude of troops.
Counters, cards, a dice, the victory is in your hands!

The Persians expansion contains

1 scenario booklet to play the battles of
Thymbrée (547 BC),
Marathon (490 BC),
Plataea (479 BC)

1 board of 108 pawns representing the army of the Achaemenid Persians
1 A4 card and 1 A3 card


Requires ARS BELLUM base module, Hellenic Expansion and Lydian Army Supplement

—description from the publisher (translated)

Elargissez vos perspectives de gloire avec les Extensions du jeu ARS BELLUM
Dans cette extension, retrouvez l'armée perse et sa multitude de troupes
Les pions, les cartes, un dé, la victoire est entre vos mains !

L' extension Perses contient

1 livret de scénarios pour jouer les batailles de
Thymbrée (547 av JC),
Marathon (490 av JC),
Platées (479 av JC)

1 planche de 108 pions représentant l'armée des Perses achéménides
1 carte A4 et 1 carte A3


Nécessite le module de base d'ARS BELLUM, l' Extension Hellènes et le Supplément d'armées Lydiens

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Globesweeper
boardgame.description:
Globesweeper is a twist on the classic minesweeper game. Use the numbers to work out all the tiles that are safe to reveal but be careful one mistake revealing a mine will cause the whole globe to detonate and you will have to start again!

With hexagon, triangle and classic square game modes, 5 different globe sizes and 4 difficulty settings you can be playing on anything from tiny hexagonal globes made of 92 tiles to colossal triangle globes with 20,480 tiles.

Play in traditional or guaranteed solvable mode where you never have to guess.

Gain achievements to unlock all 14 themes including planet Earth, the Moon, Mars, stylish gold, ruby, emerald and sapphire.

Can you beat a colossal globe?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Soul Tokens
boardgame.description:
We tried to make a combination of Cards Against Humanity and the game of Life, and what we came up with is something way better. Start Soul Tokens blind draw of Race, Gender, and 2 Wild cards. Move through 84 game tiles, each one represents 1 year of your life. Your story grows as life randomly inflicts itself on you. Trade, coerce. cooperate, and compete with other players. Whoever has the most SOUL TOKENS when you die wins.

Soul tokens the Ruthless game of real life combines side-splitting humor with dreamlike exploration of the human condition. Easy to play, rich in content, extraordinary in style: Soul Tokens gives players an opportunity to come together and laugh with subjects like race, gender, sex, aging, inequality, mental illnesses, and death.

In Soul Tokens you and your friends begin at birth with a set of random but defining characteristics and go through hilarious life scenarios in an attempt to keep your soul. It's a game of real life where you're striving to get soul tokens in a world of harsh but funny truths. Soul Tokens is a simple roll and move game, where each roll of the dice moves you forward in life birth to death. 84 spaces represent the average life expectancy, moving players through 4 stages of life: child, young adult, adult, and old.

Start the game with a Race, Gender, and 2 Wild cards. Trade, coerce, connect with other players as new cards enrich your stories all the while competing for soul tokens. At this level, Soul Tokens plays like a fast and funny party game, but at some point, it crosses over into the surreal.

A lighthearted and profound departure from the tabletop board games lets you make fun of all that sh*t in your life that’s been bumming you out. It puts you in the shoes of another person. This is a game that doesn’t even have a genre.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: You Know You are African When...
boardgame.description:
How many times have you been asked if you speak African?
How many times have you rolled your eyes when the insect in the "feed children in Africa" commercial appears?
Or when a friend who has never left the continent has a British accent?
What is the first thing that you think of when you hear these words: African parents, a black cat, Nigeria, South Africa, Kenya, Egypt?

This is a pretty straightforward game.
Each round, a rotating dictator (decision maker) reads a Question card and citizens (players) answer with the best fitting or funniest Answer card in their hand.
The dictator reads the Answer cards aloud and decides who wins each round. A new round starts and a new dictator takes over.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: How Nigerian Are You?
boardgame.description:
The First Nigerian Trivia Game!

Get ready to go down memory lane in an exciting team game that tests your knowledge of Nigeria’s History & Historical Figures, Entertainment (music, sports, etc.) and Riddles.

In the box : over 400 questions + hints, answers, a sand timer and a game guide.

Sixty-second rounds require quick thinking and strategizing. Team planning is encouraged to decide when to use your delegation powers and whom to delegate to.

Pick a side to play (low or high difficulty.)
Use a hint if you need one, but you’ll only get half of the points.
Successfully complete Hammer questions to significantly bump your team’s score.

Not Nigerian or don’t know much about Nigeria?
This is a great way to learn!
The timekeeper and scorekeeper roles give you the opportunity to participate and learn.

boardgame.name: Pop Justice
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Pop Justice is a superhero game that takes place just a commercial break into the future. The concept of juries was expanded to the entire public, making celebrities almost immune to prosecution. What will it cost you to fight for the Truth when corruption and lies have so many followers?

boardgame.name: Blitz Bowl: Season 2
boardgame.description:
Welcome Sports Fans! Blitz Bowl – Season 2 is a fast-paced sports game that pits two teams against each other in a battle to achieve touchdowns, complete Challenges, and score the most points, through a mixture of skill, luck, and aggression!

The teams are small, the games are fast, and the action is intense as each player seeks to distinguish themselves in the eyes of Nuffle in the infamous Crush recruitment rituals. Blitz Bowl features a number of elements that will be familiar to fans of Blood Bowl, so the two games are ideal companions to each other.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Jollof Wars
boardgame.description:
The West African Party Game!

Your favorite game formats and words that represent you in one game!!

In the box : over 450 words, a sand timer, a game guide and a mini West African overview.

The goal is to get your team to say the word on the card. Sixty-second rounds require quick thinking.

Choose a color to play and flip the cards so that the color you have chosen faces down.
The color you choose to play determines how you will play the game:

Red: Describe the word by using 1 word and gestures (how will you describe Shaku Shaku?)
White: Describe the word by using no more than 5 words (how will you describe Kofi Annan?)
Green: Describe the word by explaining however you would like to (how will you describe Useless?)
Yellow: Describe the word by singing or rapping (how will you describe Akon or Makossa?)


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Eldruden: Godchild: Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Eldruden. God is dead and so are his Angels. Demons and Devils maraud the haunted landscape of Eldruden Earth, where humans hang from the skies, Hell has fused with nearly ninety percent of the Earth, and the oceans, seas, rivers and lakes have turned to blood.

Humanity is threatened with extinction. Hell Storms frequent the remaining cities. Butcher men prowl the streets in packs, preying on innocents. Serial Killers are initiated into demonic cults where their deadly art is refined and skills honed.

boardgame.name: Rest In Pieces (Preview/Teaser Version)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Fill the shoes of a fed up deadbeat that happens to share a pad with none other than the Grim Reaper!
...
In Rest in Pieces, players act as broke deadbeat roommates stuck sharing a small studio apartment with a wickedly powerful, possessive, and problematic roommate. As frustrations mount, players play the game to see how their deadbeats ultimately deal with their bad days and difficult friendships.

boardgame.name: Rest in Pieces
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Fill the shoes of a fed-up deadbeat roommate that happens to share a pad with none other than the Grim Reaper!

What can go wrong, does go wrong in this ridiculous game about difficult friendships and bad days.

Rest in Pieces is a dark comedy RPG that plays with a unique 108 card deck and a two-color block tower in the spirit of shows like The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy, The Regular Show,and It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia.

boardgame.name: Momotaro Dentetsu: Showa Heisei Reiwa mo Teiban!
boardgame.description: Cartoon

boardgame.name: Dynasty Warriors 9: Empires
boardgame.description: Historical

boardgame.name: Z/X: Zillions of enemy X
boardgame.description:
Z/X (pronounced as Zeks) is a one-on-one trading card game created by Broccoli and Nippon Ichi Software where the players fight against each other on 3×3 squares battlefield using different combination of offensive and defensive strategy based on 5 different worlds.

In Z/X, the first player who makes their opponent lose all 4 of their lives win.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dice Fishing D6
boardgame.description:
A Solitaire Print and Play Fishing Dice Game!

In this solitaire fishing dice game You roll 3 six-sided dice. You catch a fish when you roll doubles and one different number, that different number is the kind of fish you catch.

You must always catch the small fish of a kind first, then you may catch the big one. You can never catch the big one first if the small one is still available! once you catch both of a kind those are no longer available.

Small fish are worth 1 point, big fish are worth 2 points!

If you roll trips of any kind you can catch any fish you want respecting the small to big fish catching rule. In other words, when choosing which fish to catch after rolling trips, if a small one of that kind is available you must catch the small one, but if the small one has already been caught, you can go ahead and take the big one!

You can always use a "Lucky Nudges" box to change the number of one die, but only by one unit, either up or down. As an example you can change a number 2 roll to a 1 or a 3 by marking one of the "Lucky Nudges" boxes. Use the lucky nudges carefully, you don't get more than the available four per game! Once they're gone, they're gone!

If you roll 1 2 3 the game ends immediately! The game also ends with a 4 5 6 roll or by rolling three "Awful Casts!" An Awful Cast roll is a "nothing" roll! Like a 1 4 6 or 3 4 5 for example (if you happen to "catch" a fish that's already been caught, nothing happens, roll again, this is not considered a "nothing" roll). So When you roll an "Awful Cast" mark one of the appropriate boxes. If all three get marked the game ends. BUT! with the 4 5 6 roll and the Awful Casts you may use one of your Lucky Nudges to keep going AND maybe even catch a fish in the process! As long as lucky Nudges are still available of course.

Keep rolling until you either catch all the fish or run out of luck! Happy Fishing!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Футуриум
boardgame.description:
Conversation party in a futuristic setting. The Futurium board game was released by Muravey Games in 2017.

Game participants are invited to become creators of the future, science fiction writers, and cyber prophets.

Imagine the world in 20-30 years, when it will change beyond recognition. Futurium is a conversation game that allows you to immerse yourself in this world! By playing, players can create a future that even great science fiction writers never dreamed of!

Each time they open the box, players become creators of a future reality. The game offers many versions of the future and a huge number of unexpected developments. For example, humanity in your game can move to live underwater or, conversely, fly away to colonize Mars in its entirety, or simply surrender all control in the world to intelligent robots, while ceasing to work at all. Each game takes place in a different future - each time in a new way!

The game is suitable for both novice players and experienced ones. Whether it's fun, serious, or completely insane - you choose what your future will be like!

It's easy to play:
1. Open cards with names of objects
2. Invent and tell what one of the objects will become in the future
3. Those interested can tell alternative versions
4. Vote for the most interesting version
This continues for several "circles".
At the end of the game, the one who gets the most votes will be the winner.

boardgame.name: The Badgerhound
boardgame.description:
"A telepathic doggo to add to your party!
Includes lore connected to the badgerhound and has abilities that connect to dachshund personality."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Infinite Minutes
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:
Infinite Minutes is a "chamber" live role-playing game for 7-9 players and aims to evoke an interstellar journey in a simple room

boardgame.name: Le Mother Phoquer
boardgame.description:
PARTY GAME: + Trash + Dirty + Better. Make funny and unusual card combinations to make a lot of players laugh. Discomfort and laughter guaranteed!
GAMEPLAY: The "Seal", designated at the start of the game, distributes 6 Response cards to the players. He then reads 1 Hole-Pitch phrase aloud. Each person completes the blank sentence with one of their Answer cards. Whoever has the funniest phrase wins and becomes the new "Seal".
400 TRASH HUMOR CARDS: All the most trashy and annoying cards in one game. Judge the humor of your friends with thousands of possible combinations.

—description from the publisher (translated)

JEU DE SOIRÉE : + Trash + Sale + Mieux. Fais des combinaisons de cartes drôles et insolites pour faire rire un max de joueurs. Malaises et fous rires garantis !
GAMEPLAY : Le Phoquer, désigné en début de partie, distribue 6 cartes Réponses aux joueurs. Il lit ensuite 1 carte Phrase à trou à voix haute. Chacun complète la phrase à trou avec une de ses cartes Réponses. Celui qui a la phrase la plus drôle gagne et devient le nouveau Phoquer.
400 CARTES D'HUMOUR TRASH : Toutes les cartes les plus trash et génantes réunies dans un jeu. Juge l'humour de tes potes avec des milliers de combinaisons possibles.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dědicové trůnu
Heimliche Herrschaft
Hidden Leaders
Ukryci liderzy
Vezércsel
Таємні лідери
히든 리더스
boardgame.description:
The island of Oshra is in turmoil. Following the death of the Emperor, the conflict between the Hill Tribes and the Imperial Army escalated. While the Water People try to maintain balance between the old rivals, the Undead aim to escalate the war. All hope rests on the six children of the Emperor: Who of them will claim the throne?

In Hidden Leaders, you take the role of one of six secret leaders, each of them is allied with two of the four factions/colors. By playing heroes into your tableau, either openly or secretly, you influence the outcome of the conflict.

At the end of the game, one of the four factions will win:

Red leading > Red victory
Green leading > Green victory
Tie between Red & Green > Blue victory
Red & Green in War Zone > Black victory


Each player who is aligned with the winning faction can claim the victory. However, they must have more heroes of this color than any competitor.

Hidden Leaders is a quick, light strategy card game with direct player interaction. It combines tableau building and deduction elements with its unique winning mechanism. This is a game of great tension with no-down time, that’s fast to learn. Its distinctive artwork and character names will make you smile.

—description from designer

boardgame.name: SportsBall Madness
boardgame.description:
SportsBall Madness is a strategy dice game where the objective is to earn the most prize money across several tournaments (rounds). Your dice are your team of players, and as team managers you wisely choose which players to compete in each round. As the tournament progresses dice become injured, allowing teams to come back from behind and rake in easy wins.

After each tournament, you have the opportunity to pay from your winnings to keep your team together, or send players to the draft pool in the hopes of getting to pick an even better team for the next round.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: On the Wall (fan expansion for T.I.M.E. Stories)
boardgame.description:
Explore new - but strangely familiar - kingdoms in order to bring back an influential empress who has gone missing in 815 FT.

This scenario has a strong focus on story line and relies on your deduction skills to solve multiple puzzles. It can be played separately from the T.I.M.E. Stories universe, while it carries a few winks to the original white cycle.

Each scene is accompanied by a thematic playlist on Spotify.

boardgame.name: Captain Xenros' Mercantile Manual
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Greetings! I am Captain Xendros, merchant of the Faithful Quartermasters of Iuz. I have travelled across the known world, and much of the unknown too, from the jungles of Chult to the depths of the Underdark, so I have seen a thing or two. That is why I have decided to write down some of my expertise when it comes to selling items, magical and mundane.

In any case, I hope you find this manual illuminating, and that you use it to turn those treasures and trinkets into cold hard cash! Then, if you need some help getting rid of that cash, come and find me in the town of Saltmarsh, and we will test how much you have learned…

boardgame.name: Mess and Malnourishment
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Sea rations and se borne illnesses in the Forgotten Realms and beyond.
...
This supplement is meant to be used in conjunction with the optional crew rules that are laid out on page 196 of Ghosts of Saltmarsh and is meant to provide more realistic mechanics in terms of the types of malnourishment related diseases that can occur on board ships during the normal course of sea travel.

boardgame.name: Combat: The Thrill of Combat – The Power of Command
boardgame.description:
Combat is a set of wargame rules for World War II, inspired by several other rules such as Rapid Fire, Bolt Action, and Flames of War. The main objective is to provide an easy-to-learn regulation, but don’t forget the realism and historical accuracy.

Main features:
1 - Rules developed for different scales, from 6mm to 20mm, at Squad level.
2 - Valorization of the chain of command.
3 - An original system of randomized movement of units that are out of the chain of command - a system that can also be easily adapted for solo play.
4 - Range definitions in centimeters and hexagons, allowing games on maps without markings and on maps with hexagonal grids.

boardgame.name: Of Smoke and Splinters
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Expanded maritime combat rules for Ghosts of Saltmarsh.

boardgame.name: Conspiracy in the Stars
boardgame.description:
From the Introduction:

Conspiracy in the Stars! is an adventure for the 5th Edition of the world’s greatest roleplaying game, designed as an introduction to Mage Hand Press’s campaign setting Dark Matter. It requires the Game Master (GM) to have access to the Dark Matter book or the Dark Matter Basic Rules. The adventure challenges the players to unravel the intrigue surrounding an assassination attempt, dealing with a variety of characters with their own goals and schemes. Their investigation ultimately culminates in a dogfight across an asteroid field to rescue a gnomish scientist, whose newest invention could change the very future of the entire 'verse.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Dressing - Containers
boardgame.description:
From Website:

Quickly and easily populate your dungeon map with all sorts of highly detailed and colorful items using Role 4 Initiative's Dungeon Dressing. Each sheet contains dozens of vinyl stickers that are repositionable, reusable, and compatible with both dry- and wet-erase markers so they can be used on any battlemat or set of dungeon tiles.

boardgame.name: Dark Matter Starter Kit
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter:

Dark Matter is a rip-roaring futuristic campaign setting, which lets you play DnD in Space without learning a new system.
...
The starter kit contains everything you need to get started playing Dark Matter right away! It contains a full adventure, Conspiracy in the Stars, pregenerated characters, a GM Screen, Basic Dark Matter rules, dice, battle maps, and more! With this box, you can dip your toes into the sprawling universe of Dark Matter, even if you’ve never played DnD before. Makes a great gift for newbies and RPG veterans alike!

boardgame.name: Railroad Ink: Creepy – Dobbelspel
Railroad Ink: Eldritch Expansion Pack
Railroad Ink: Würfelerweiterung Eldritch
boardgame.description:
In the multiplayer puzzle game Railroad Ink™, your goal is to connect as many exits on your board as possible.
Each round, a set of dice are rolled in the middle of the table, determining which kind of road and railway routes are available to all players.

Use the 4 special dice of the Eldritch Expansion Pack in addition to your regular Route dice, and find new ways to score points:


Ritual (1 die): open new Portals and add mysterious Rituals to create a Madness Network!
Portal (1 die): open different supernatural Portals to connect distant areas of your network!
Tentacle (1 die): extend Tentacles along your network as much as you can to get bonus points for each space occupied!
Investigation (1 die): send your Investigator to collect Clues to solve the case and gain extra points!


Note: at least one core set of Railroad Ink™ or Railroad Ink Challenge™ is required to use this expansion pack.

Railroad Ink Challenge: Shining Yellow Edition
